newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Australia's Ampol to cut September runs at Lytton.
newsitem.headline: Australia's Ampol to cut September runs at Lytton.

text.p: Australia's largest refiner Ampol Petroleum Pty Ltd plans to cut refinery runs at its 100,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery in Lytton, Brisbane, by up to six percent from September, industry sources said on Friday.
Ampol was also considering a seven-percent cut in throughputs at its 115,000 bpd Kurnell refinery in October, they said.
"At this stage, the reduction is only for a month but it really depends on margins," one source said.
Ampol officials were not available for comment.
Ampol plans a scheduled 10-day shutdown of a 20,000 bpd reformer at Kurnell, which produces gasoline from straight run naphtha, in the second half of September.
A second 20,000 bpd reformer may also be shut down for regeneration in October, an industry source said.
